Sun of Faith - English: Chapter 16. The Bodhisattva Takes Mrigaja in Marriage
Once when the Bodhisattva was travelling around the city, a remarkable woman, Shakya Kalasadhu's daughter named Mrigaja, was looking from her window when she saw the Bodhisattva.
Manual - English: Again, near a mansion, the Buddha rides in a carriage.  Mṛgajā sees the Bodhisattva from a window at the mansion. The Bodhisattva throws his pearl rosary which lands around her neck.

Sun of Faith - English: O, how happy must be his mother. How happy his father must be too. O, the woman who becomes his wife, Will pass beyond suffering.
The Bodhisattva was delighted when he heard the words "peace" and "pass beyond suffering." He thew a pearl necklace toward the woman, and it went through the window to land around her neck.
People who witnessed this told the king, who took Mrigaja along with her entourage of twenty-thousand women to be the Bodhisattva's queen.
Manual - English: In a mansion, the Bodhisattva takes Mrigaja as his bride.

Sun of Faith - English: In brief, the Bodhisattva's three supreme queens each had an entourage of twenty-thousand, so that he had sixty thousand queens.
